[2;36m                    [0m         [39m# Evaluation Report[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m## Summary[0m                                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe initial issue is an AddressSanitizer error reporting a double-free [0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mvulnerability in the `parse_path_argument` function at line [0m[1;36m68[0m[39m of [0m                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`src/shared/parse-argument.c`. The error occurs when running the [0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`fuzz-systemctl-parse-argv` fuzzer. A patch was attempted to resolve this issue by [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39madding a `_cleanup_free_` attribute to the local variable `p` and modifying the [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mlogic for handling the `suppress_root` condition. However, after applying the [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mpatch, the same double-free error persists at the same location, indicating that [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mthe patch did not successfully resolve the underlying memory management issue.[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m## Description[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m### Initial Issue Analysis[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe AddressSanitizer report reveals a double-free vulnerability with the following [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mcharacteristics:[0m                                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Error Location:**[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The double-free occurs at line [0m[1;36m68[0m[39m in [0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`[0m[35m/work/build/../../src/systemd/src/shared/[0m[95mparse-argument.c[0m[39m` within the [0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`parse_path_argument` function.[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The memory address `[0m[1;36m0x502000007310[0m[39m` [0m[1;39m([0m[1;36m16[0m[39m-byte region[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m is being freed twice.[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Call Stack Trace:**[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1[0m[39m. First free: Occurs during `static_destruct` cleanup in `LLVMFuzzerTestOneInput` [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mat line [0m[1;36m74[0m[39m of `fuzz-systemctl-parse-argv.c`[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2[0m[39m. Second free [0m[1;39m([0m[39mdouble-free[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m: Occurs in `parse_path_argument` at line [0m[1;36m68[0m[39m, called [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfrom `systemctl_parse_argv` at line [0m[1;36m732[0m                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Memory Lifecycle:**[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The memory is originally allocated via `realloc` in `path_extend_internal` at [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mline [0m[1;36m585[0m[39m of `src/basic/path-util.c`[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- This allocation occurs through the call chain: `path_make_absolute_cwd` → [0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`parse_path_argument` → `systemctl_parse_argv`[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe DEDUP_TOKEN indicates the issue involves interactions between the interceptor [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfree operations and the static destruction mechanism.[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m### Patch Attempt Description[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe patch made the following modifications to `src/shared/parse-argument.c`:[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Changes:**[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1[0m[39m. Modified line [0m[1;36m56[0m[39m: Changed `char *p;` to `_cleanup_free_ char *p = NULL;`[0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - This adds automatic cleanup semantics to the pointer `p` using the [0m            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`_cleanup_free_` attribute[0m                                                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2[0m[39m. Modified the `suppress_root` conditional block [0m[1;39m([0m[39mlines [0m[1;36m77[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m79[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m:[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Original code:[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m     ```c[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m     if [0m[1;39m([0m[39msuppress_root && [0m[1;35mempty_or_root[0m[1;39m([0m[39mp[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m         p = [0m[1;35mmfree[0m[1;39m([0m[39mp[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m     ```[0m                                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Patched code:[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m     ```c[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m     if [0m[1;39m([0m[39msuppress_root && [0m[1;35mempty_or_root[0m[1;39m([0m[39mp[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m         *arg = [0m[1;35mmfree[0m[1;39m([0m[39m*arg[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m         return [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m;[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m     [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m     ```[0m                                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - This changes the behavior to free `*arg` instead of `p` and returns early[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3[0m[39m. The final `return [0m[1;35mfree_and_replace[0m[1;39m([0m[39m*arg, p[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;` statement remains unchanged[0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m### Patch Result Analysis[0m                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mAfter applying the patch, the AddressSanitizer report shows:[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Unchanged Aspects:**[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The same double-free error occurs at the exact same location [0m[1;39m([0m[39mline [0m[1;36m68[0m[39m in [0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`parse_path_argument`[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The memory address and allocation/deallocation patterns remain identical[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- Both free operations occur at the same call sites as before[0m                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m- The DEDUP_TOKENs are identical, indicating the same root cause persists[0m           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m**Key Observation:**[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe patch introduced `_cleanup_free_` for variable `p`, which means `p` will be [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mautomatically freed when it goes out of scope. However, the error still occurs at [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mline [0m[1;36m68[0m[39m, and the call stack shows the same pattern of first being freed in [0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`static_destruct` and then again in `parse_path_argument`.[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m### Areas Requiring Further Investigation[0m                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mTo gain a holistic understanding of this double-free issue, the following areas of [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mthe codebase should be investigated:[0m                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1[0m[39m. **`src/shared/parse-argument.c` [0m[1;39m([0m[39mparse_path_argument function[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m:**[0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Complete implementation of the `parse_path_argument` function, particularly [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39maround lines [0m[1;36m68[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m82[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The interaction between the `_cleanup_free_` attribute and the [0m                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`free_and_replace` function[0m                                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - How the `*arg` parameter is managed throughout the function[0m                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m2[0m[39m. **`src/systemctl/systemctl.c` [0m[1;39m([0m[39msystemctl_parse_argv function[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m:**[0m                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Line [0m[1;36m732[0m[39m where `parse_path_argument` is called[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - How the output parameter is declared and managed[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Whether the same pointer is used in multiple calls or stored in static/global [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mcontexts[0m                                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m3[0m[39m. **`src/systemctl/fuzz-systemctl-parse-argv.c`:**[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Lines [0m[1;36m58[0m[39m and [0m[1;36m74[0m[39m, showing where `systemctl_parse_argv` is called and where [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`static_destruct` cleanup occurs[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The lifecycle and ownership of variables being passed to [0m                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m`systemctl_parse_argv`[0m                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - How the fuzzer harness initializes and manages memory[0m                          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m4[0m[39m. **`src/basic/static-destruct.h`:**[0m                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Line [0m[1;36m95[0m[39m in the `static_destruct` function[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The mechanism for tracking and freeing statically-allocated or global [0m         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mresources[0m                                                                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - Whether pointers are being registered multiple times for cleanup[0m               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m5[0m[39m. **`src/basic/path-util.c`:**[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The `path_make_absolute_cwd` and `path_extend_internal` functions[0m              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - How memory is allocated and ownership is transferred[0m                           [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The contract for caller responsibility regarding memory management[0m             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m6[0m[39m. **Memory Management Utilities:**[0m                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The implementation of `free_and_replace` macro/function[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The implementation of `mfree` function[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m   - The `_cleanup_free_` attribute mechanism and its interaction with explicit [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfree operations[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mThe core issue appears to involve a conflict between automatic cleanup mechanisms [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;39m([0m[39m`_cleanup_free_`, `static_destruct`[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m and manual memory management operations [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;39m([0m[39m`free_and_replace`, `mfree`[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m, potentially resulting in the same memory being freed[0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mthrough multiple paths.[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m                                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m## Initial Issue Log[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mHere is the initial issue log of the codebase:[0m                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<issue>[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m61[0m[39m:         * in. It makes the path absolute, and reduces it to NULL if omitted or [0m [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1133[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1134[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m else if [0m[1;39m([0m[1;35minvoked_as[0m[1;39m([0m[39margv, [0m[32m"init"[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1135[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1136[0m[39m:                [0m[35m/[0m[39m* Matches invocations as [0m[32m"init"[0m[39m as well as [0m[32m"telinit"[0m[39m, which [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mare synonymous when run[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1137[0m[39m:                 * as PID != [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m on SysV.[0m                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1138[0m[39m:                 *[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1139[0m[39m:                 * On SysV [0m[32m"telinit"[0m[39m was the official command to communicate [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mwith PID [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m, but [0m[32m"init"[0m[39m would[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1140[0m[39m:                 * redirect itself to [0m[32m"telinit"[0m[39m if called with PID != [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m. We [0m   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfollow the same logic here still,[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1141[0m[39m:                 * though we add one level of indirection, as we implement [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [32m"telinit"[0m[39m in [0m[32m"systemctl"[0m[39m. Hence,[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1142[0m[39m:                 * for us if you invoke [0m[32m"init"[0m[39m you get [0m[32m"systemd"[0m[39m, but it will [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;35mexecve[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[32m"systemctl"[0m                                                                [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1143[0m[39m:                 * immediately with argv[0m[1;39m[[0m[1;39m][0m[39m unmodified if PID is != [0m[1;36m1[0m[39m. If you [0m  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39minvoke [0m[32m"telinit"[0m[39m you directly[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1144[0m[39m:                 * get [0m[32m"systemctl"[0m[39m. In both cases we shall do the same thing, [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mwhich is why we do[0m                                                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1145[0m[39m:                 * [0m[1;35minvoked_as[0m[1;39m([0m[39margv, [0m[32m"init"[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m here, as a quick way to match [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mboth.[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1146[0m[39m:                 *[0m                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1147[0m[39m:                 * Also see [0m[1;35mredirect_telinit[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m in src/core/main.c. *[0m[35m/[0m          [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1148[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1149[0m[39m:                arg_action = _ACTION_INVALID; [0m[35m/[0m[39m* [0m[1;35mtelinit_parse_argv[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m will [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfigure out the actual action we'll execute *[0m[35m/[0m                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1150[0m[39m:                return [0m[1;35mtelinit_parse_argv[0m[1;39m([0m[39margc, argv[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1151[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1152[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m[39m else if [0m[1;39m([0m[1;35minvoked_as[0m[1;39m([0m[39margv, [0m[32m"runlevel"[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1153[0m[39m:                arg_action = ACTION_RUNLEVEL;[0m                                  [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1154[0m[39m:                return [0m[1;35mrunlevel_parse_argv[0m[1;39m([0m[39margc, argv[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1155[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1156[0m[39m:[0m                                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1157[0m[39m:        arg_action = ACTION_SYSTEMCTL;[0m                                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1158[0m[39m:        return [0m[1;35msystemctl_parse_argv[0m[1;39m([0m[39margc, argv[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m1159[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<[0m[35m/[0m[95mcode[0m[39m>[0m                                                                             [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<code>[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39msrc/udev/fuzz-udev-rules.[0m[1;92mc:12[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m35[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m12[0m[39m:int [0m[1;35mLLVMFuzzerTestOneInput[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst uint8_t *data, size_t size[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m13[0m[39m:        [0m[1;35m_cleanup_[0m[1;39m([0m[39mudev_rules_freep[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m UdevRules *rules = NULL;[0m                     [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m35[0m[39m:        if [0m[1;39m([0m[1;35mstrv_length[0m[1;39m([0m[39margv[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m > [0m[1;36m1024[0m[1;39m)[0m                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m36[0m[39m:                return [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m; [0m[35m/[0m[39m* oss-fuzz reports timeouts which are caused by [0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mappending to a very long strv.[0m                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m37[0m[39m:                           * The code is indeed not very efficient, but it's [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mdesigned for normal command-line[0m                                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m38[0m[39m:                           * use, where we don't expect more than a dozen of [0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mentries. The fact that it is[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m39[0m[39m:                           * slow with ~100k entries is not particularly [0m        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39minteresting. Let's just refuse such[0m                                                 [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m52[0m[39m:        [0m[35m/[0m[39m* We need to reset some global state manually here since libfuzzer [0m     [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m55[0m[39m:int [0m[1;35mparse_path_argument[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst char *path, bool suppress_root, char **arg[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m56[0m[39m:        char *p;[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m58[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m59[0m[39m:        [0m[35m/[0m[39m*[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m60[0m[39m:         * This function is intended to be used in command line parsers, to [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mhandle paths that are passed[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m61[0m[39m:         * in. It makes the path absolute, and reduces it to NULL if omitted or [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mroot [0m[1;39m([0m[39mthe latter optionally[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m62[0m[39m:         *[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m63[0m[39m:         * NOTE THAT THIS WILL FREE THE PREVIOUS ARGUMENT POINTER ON SUCCESS![0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m64[0m[39m:         * Hence, do not pass in uninitialized pointers.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m65[0m[39m:         *[0m[35m/[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m71[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<code>[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39msrc/shared/parse-argument.[0m[1;92mc:55[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m81[0m                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39m```[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m55[0m[39m:int [0m[1;35mparse_path_argument[0m[1;39m([0m[39mconst char *path, bool suppress_root, char **arg[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m56[0m[39m:        char *p;[0m                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m57[0m[39m:        int r;[0m                                                                   [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m58[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m59[0m[39m:        [0m[35m/[0m[39m*[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m60[0m[39m:         * This function is intended to be used in command line parsers, to [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mhandle paths that are passed[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m61[0m[39m:         * in. It makes the path absolute, and reduces it to NULL if omitted or [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mroot [0m[1;39m([0m[39mthe latter optionally[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m.[0m                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m62[0m[39m:         *[0m                                                                       [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m63[0m[39m:         * NOTE THAT THIS WILL FREE THE PREVIOUS ARGUMENT POINTER ON SUCCESS![0m    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m64[0m[39m:         * Hence, do not pass in uninitialized pointers.[0m                         [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m65[0m[39m:         *[0m[35m/[0m                                                                      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m66[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m67[0m[39m:        if [0m[1;39m([0m[1;35misempty[0m[1;39m([0m[39mpath[0m[1;39m)[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m [0m[1;39m{[0m                                                     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m68[0m[39m:                *arg = [0m[1;35mmfree[0m[1;39m([0m[39m*arg[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m69[0m[39m:                return [0m[1;36m0[0m[39m;[0m                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m70[0m[39m:        [0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                        [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m71[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m72[0m[39m:        r = [0m[1;35mpath_make_absolute_cwd[0m[1;39m([0m[39mpath, &p[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                    [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m73[0m[39m:        if [0m[1;39m([0m[39mr < [0m[1;36m0[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                               [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m74[0m[39m:                return [0m[1;35mlog_error_errno[0m[1;39m([0m[39mr, [0m[32m"Failed to parse path \"%s\" and make [0m [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [32mit absolute: %m"[0m[39m, path[0m[1;39m)[0m[39m;[0m                                                            [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m75[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m79[0m[39m:[0m                                                                                 [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m81[0m[39m:[0m[1;39m}[0m                                                                                [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [39m<code>[0m                                                                              [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39msrc/systemctl/fuzz-systemctl-parse-argv.[0m[1;92mc:52[0m[39m-[0m[1;36m76[0m                                     [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m52[0m[39m:        [0m[35m/[0m[39m* We need to reset some global state manually here since libfuzzer [0m     [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [39mfeeds a single process with[0m                                                         [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m59[0m[39m:        if [0m[1;39m([0m[39mr < [0m[1;36m0[0m[1;39m)[0m                                                               [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m61[0m[39m:        else[0m                                                                     [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m67[0m[39m:        [0m[1;35mrelease_busses[0m[1;39m([0m[1;39m)[0m[39m; [0m[35m/[0m[39m* We open the bus for communication with logind.[0m      [2m                [0m
[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m68[0m[39m:                           * It needs to be closed to avoid apparent leaks. *[0m[35m/[0m   [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m72[0m[39m:        [0m[35m/[0m[39m* Call static destructors to do global state cleanup. We do it here, [0m   [2m                [0m

[2;36m                    [0m         [1;36m73[0m[39m:         * any global state is destroyed between fuzzer runs. *[0m[35m/[0m                 [2m                [0m
